instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 3330 - need <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> bypass to get SD reader working.
threads.message:
Firewire and ethernet were shorted on PPBUS. i had to dig a massive hole to remove the short. i also have to disable <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> because <SIGNAL>PP1V2_ENET</SIGNAL> line is also shorted.

now the board doesn't have firewire, ethernet and SD card. Why does SD card require <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> for data connection??? anyway, to bypass <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> so it doesn't care about sd wake?

besides 3 problems, the board is fully working without error.

threads.title: 820 3330 - need <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> bypass to get SD reader working.
threads.message:
As per schematic, SD Card connector lines go directly to <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> (BCM57765B0), which is also Ethernet controller.
Remove <RESISTOR>R3943</RESISTOR>, to prevent wake issue.

threads.title: 820 3330 - need <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> bypass to get SD reader working.
threads.message: ok, i'll remove it. so RIP SD reader. :(

threads.title: 820 3330 - need <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> bypass to get SD reader working.
threads.message:
SD card reader communicates with PCH via SPI protocol, through <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.
SD to USB adapter is the only solution left...
